s.text: Everyone always talks about the genius of Pat Oliphant, and he is an amazing draftsman, but he doesn't give a shit about anything, which makes his work soulless.
Everyone always talks about the genius of Pat Oliphant, and he is an amazing draftsman, but he doesn't give a shit about anything, which makes his work soulless.
I'm jealous of the ideas that guy comes up with--always topical, hilarious, sardonic, smart.
I'm jealous of the ideas that guy comes up with--always topical, hilarious, sardonic, smart.
I'm jealous of the ideas that guy comes up with--always topical, hilarious, sardonic, smart.
He's so totally self-loathing I keep worrying that he'll kill himself before he does the next one, which would be sad since he's such a genius.
People always relate to the familiar and iconic and reject what's truly new.

But the bottom line is, post-Dada art is subjective, and there's no way any group of government experts can render a fair judgment as to what's good art and what isn't.
But the bottom line is, post-Dada art is subjective, and there's no way any group of government experts can render a fair judgment as to what's good art and what isn't.
I shouldn't leave out comic books; I like Peter Bagge ("Hate"), but I think Ivan Brunetti, who does a filthy, rancid, brutal comic book called "Schizo" is brilliant.
I've read book after book by this guy in an effort to understand why he's so highly regarded by comics critics, but I don't get it--maybe it's his fondness for retro '20s graphics.

All superhero comic books are stupid, have always been stupid, and should be banned by law--and all of their readers over 8 should be deported to post-coup Pakistan for service in the coming war against India.
